Yes, there are several companies in the diamond industry that have made sustainability a priority in their operations. Below are a few examples:

1. Rio Tinto: Rio Tinto is a diversified mining company that operates several diamond mines around the world. The company has a strong commitment to environmental sustainability and has implemented several measures to reduce the impact of its mining activities on the environment. For instance, it has developed a biodiversity offset program at its Argyle mine in Australia to protect the surrounding ecosystem.

2. Alrosa: Alrosa is a Russian diamond mining company that is the largest producer of diamonds by volume in the world. The company has made significant efforts to reduce its environmental impact, such as by implementing a water recycling system at its Mirny mine, and also prioritizes social responsibility, with initiatives to support local communities and protect human rights.

3. Lucara Diamond Corp: Lucara is a Canadian diamond mining company that operates the Karowe mine in Botswana. The company has a strong focus on sustainability and has implemented several initiatives to reduce its carbon footprint and promote responsible mining practices. In 2020, Lucara also announced that it had produced the world's first carbon-neutral diamond, which was verified by third-party assessors.

4. Tiffany & Co.: Tiffany & Co. is a luxury jewellery retailer that has made significant efforts to promote responsible sourcing and sustainability in the diamond industry. The company has established strict sourcing standards and works closely with suppliers to ensure that its diamonds are ethically and sustainably sourced. In addition, it has also launched initiatives to support conservation efforts and protect wildlife habitats in areas where it sources diamonds.
